metadata.name: Foundational & Methodological
metadata.description: General-purpose linguistic, methodological, and academic terms used across subfields.

entries.definition: The scientific study of human language, including its structure, meaning, and use.
Concerned with practical use or real-world application rather than abstract theory.
Referring to language itself or the analysis of language using language.
Relating to teaching, learning, or instructional design.
examples: Pedagogical examples prioritize clarity over completeness.
entries.notes: Often contrasted with descriptive or theoretical approaches.

entries.definition: Including all possible members or cases; leaving nothing out.
examples: An exhaustive list of verb senses is impractical.

entries.definition: Serving to identify or distinguish linguistic categories or relations.
examples: The 'is-a-kind-of' test is diagnostic for hyponymy.
